content: "As the old political saying goes, you can’t beat somebody with nobody. But a plurality of national Republican voters still think nobody’s running the show for the GOP." "Arizona Senator John McCain, last year’s unsuccessful presidential candidate who is already facing a primary challenge in 2010, is seen as the party’s leader by 18% of Republican voters. National party chairman Michael Steele, who has been plagued with gaffes since taking the job, is next with 14% support. Alaska Governor Sarah Palin, McCain’s running mate, is seen as the GOP leader by 10%." "Next for Republican voters now is former Massachusetts Governor Mitt Romney, another presidential hopeful from last year, who has eight percent (8%) support. He is followed by broadcaster Rush Limbaugh (6%) and former Vice President Dick Cheney (4%)." "As Scott Rasmussen points out in a recent analysis, “To be relevant in politics, you need either formal power or a lot of people willing to follow your lead. The governing Republicans in the nation’s capital have lost both on their continuing path to irrelevance.”" >>http://www.rasmussenreports.com/public_content/politics/general_politics/only_37_of_gop_voters_now_say_party_is_leaderless --- Savage

content: I vote for none of the above. Was Barack Obama the "leader" of the democratic party before last year? Nope. The "leaders" of the Republican Party can not and will not win in the next election. Why? Because when the media and the democrats get through with them they won't be anything but a joke in obamanation's eyes. What the Republican Party needs is new blood to lead the party into the future and I hope that these new leaders aren't in place for another six years. Why? Because by the time the democrats have control over this country for the next six years the American people will be begging for more "hope" and "change". All I wonder is if when a country goes "bankrupt", does it take seven years for it to restore it's ranking again?

content: Huckabee IS the man. He's not electable, however, because he stands for among other things, responsibility. OMG not that! Being responsible for my own actions? For cleaning up the mess that I've made of my life? We're not going for that are we folks? As long as I have the Dem. party running things, I can't lose my job. They'll bail the Company out. I'll always have medical care, because the Government will provide it. If I have way more kids than I can support, they'll take care of us all. If I can't afford College, no sweat. The Government has a program for me. With the DemocRATS we all get a piece of the pie in the sky. With Huckabee we'd have to earn that piece of pie, and in the 21st. century that's just not the American way. I'll Allow No Megalomania When I Rule The World

A new face talking the same BS won't cut it. The American people have spoken...no more trickle down economics, no more putting corporations above the American people. You might consider resurrecting Teddy Roosevelt, probably the only way the republican party can restore relevancy. By the way, blaming the media or the democrats won't feed the bulldog. Yeah, Keynesian Economics works so well. Obama is already warning of pending hyper-inflation. Maybe next election cycle Obama can hand out "change" buckets with his slogan on it for all of the poor people who voted for him and have seen unprecedented tax increases to pay for their health care, their college, and their constantly decreasing dollar value. And if the republican party can't come up with something besides NO...he'll still win. Nice Olberman comeback. All fluff, no facts. I guess we'll see who's talking fluff, won't we. So far, the only ones projected to get tax increases are the wealthy $250,000/yr and above. Perhaps there are lot's of republicans who will cry over that one...most of us won't.
reply: So only people who make over $250,000 per year buy cigarettes? So only people who make over $250,000 a year buy products made by the corporations that will take massive tax hits under "cap and trade" in turn passing them on to the consumer? How do you think they are going to pay for health care? More tax increases. They have discussed taxing sugary drinks, chips, and even your employer given health benefits to pay for it. And while rolling back tax cuts isn't technically a tax increase, try telling that to your decreasing paycheck.
title: So who is the Leader on the right?

title: So who is the Leader on the right?

content: "As the old political saying goes, you can’t beat somebody with nobody. But a plurality of national Republican voters still think nobody’s running the show for the GOP." "Arizona Senator John McCain, last year’s unsuccessful presidential candidate who is already facing a primary challenge in 2010, is seen as the party’s leader by 18% of Republican voters. National party chairman Michael Steele, who has been plagued with gaffes since taking the job, is next with 14% support. Alaska Governor Sarah Palin, McCain’s running mate, is seen as the GOP leader by 10%." "Next for Republican voters now is former Massachusetts Governor Mitt Romney, another presidential hopeful from last year, who has eight percent (8%) support. He is followed by broadcaster Rush Limbaugh (6%) and former Vice President Dick Cheney (4%)." "As Scott Rasmussen points out in a recent analysis, “To be relevant in politics, you need either formal power or a lot of people willing to follow your lead. The governing Republicans in the nation’s capital have lost both on their continuing path to irrelevance.”" >>http://www.rasmussenreports.com/public_content/politics/general_politics/only_37_of_gop_voters_now_say_party_is_leaderless --- Savage

content: Huckabee IS the man. He's not electable, however, because he stands for among other things, responsibility. OMG not that! Being responsible for my own actions? For cleaning up the mess that I've made of my life? We're not going for that are we folks? As long as I have the Dem. party running things, I can't lose my job. They'll bail the Company out. I'll always have medical care, because the Government will provide it. If I have way more kids than I can support, they'll take care of us all. If I can't afford College, no sweat. The Government has a program for me. With the DemocRATS we all get a piece of the pie in the sky. With Huckabee we'd have to earn that piece of pie, and in the 21st. century that's just not the American way. I'll Allow No Megalomania When I Rule The World

reply: Nice Olberman comeback. All fluff, no facts.
title: So who is the Leader on the right?

content: quote: Originally posted by stec74: quote: Originally posted by Ol_Doc: quote: Originally posted by stec74: quote: Originally posted by Ol_Doc: quote: Originally posted by stec74: I vote for none of the above. Was Barack Obama the "leader" of the democratic party before last year? Nope. The "leaders" of the Republican Party can not and will not win in the next election. Why? Because when the media and the democrats get through with them they won't be anything but a joke in obamanation's eyes. What the Republican Party needs is new blood to lead the party into the future and I hope that these new leaders aren't in place for another six years. Why? Because by the time the democrats have control over this country for the next six years the American people will be begging for more "hope" and "change". All I wonder is if when a country goes "bankrupt", does it take seven years for it to restore it's ranking again? That's lame. First of all, the democrats and the media don't need to turn the republican party into a joke...they're doing just fine on their own. Second, you believe the republican party needs new blood? A new face talking the same BS won't cut it. The American people have spoken...no more trickle down economics, no more putting corporations above the American people. You might consider resurrecting Teddy Roosevelt, probably the only way the republican party can restore relevancy. By the way, blaming the media or the democrats won't feed the bulldog. Yeah, Keynesian Economics works so well. Obama is already warning of pending hyper-inflation. Maybe next election cycle Obama can hand out "change" buckets with his slogan on it for all of the poor people who voted for him and have seen unprecedented tax increases to pay for their health care, their college, and their constantly decreasing dollar value. And if the republican party can't come up with something besides NO...he'll still win. Nice Olberman comeback. All fluff, no facts. I guess we'll see who's talking fluff, won't we. So far, the only ones projected to get tax increases are the wealthy $250,000/yr and above. Perhaps there are lot's of republicans who will cry over that one...most of us won't.
